Simplicity/Complexity: Complex ideas expressed with clarity. Balance deep insights with accessibility.
Formality Level: Moderate; formal when discussing theories or research, but personal insights are conveyed conversationally.
Narrative Voice: Combines authoritative third-person with introspective first-person, reflecting on broader implications.
Sentence Structure: Varied; complex sentences to convey nuanced ideas, interspersed with simpler, impactful statements.
Descriptive Language Use: Uses metaphor and analogy to simplify complex concepts, making abstract ideas tangible.
Tone: Intellectual and inquisitive, often blending serious discourse with a touch of humor or personal anecdotes.
